title: Brilliant
comment: Really quick, thousand times faster than anything else I've seen.
Ever since the lollipop update I lost my preferences. Now all I can do is zoom an switch between Julian an Mandelbrot. This is one of my favorite apps. Really wish this could get fixed.
Wow

title: Mandelbrot Maps
comment: Great! Awesome!

title: AWESOME APP....!!!
comment: We can easily teach fractals to students, by using this app..... ((thanks for giving this app).👍👏

title: Extremely fast
comment: This is probably the fastest Mandelbrot fractal zoomer on the web. The zoom function is much easier to use compared to the other fractal explorers. I also like how easy it is to switch to the Julia set. Plus it's open source and ad-free. There are a few things that could improve it, however. When I try to swipe around to move the view, the Julia pin appears and is distracting. Maybe disable the julia pin from appearing while moving the view. A way to view the coordinates of the julia pin would also be nice.

title: minimal
comment: doesn't overpromise, works well enough to be fun and informative ... could not find saved images, but that's ok because it can display image without adornment -> screenshot ... adding option to rotate orientation would be nice

title: Needs a coordinate system!
comment: Really awsome app, fantastic use of touch navigation. Sometimes after I have surfed the Mandelbrot, I find a segment I would like to get a external high resolution image of. A feature in your app that tells the coordinates and zoom would be really handy. Awsome work.

title: A fresh approach
comment: Very nice app, it's lovely moving your finger over the Mandelbrot Set and seeing how the corresponding Julia Set changes. Thanks x

title: Very cool & easy to use
comment: This is the best intro to Julia and Mandelbrot sets I have seen.

title: Great
comment: Showing renderning times by default seems annoying and default colouring schema may be better, does not look well for me at least at startup..  Otherwise it is a very nice, fast and intuitive viewer that makes great use of the touch screen.

title: Awesome
comment: The app is fast and beautiful.

title: AMAZING
comment: I was just an average person trying to show someone the M-Set online when I discovered this app.   Words cannot describe how phenomenal navigating through these maps are! WOW.

title: Easy to use, well colored
comment: Very nice way to navigate and explore the fractals, and the coloring is usually very visible.

title: Plaese try with other fractals like newtons.....btw nice app.
Awesome
comment: Reminds me of Arthur C. Clarke's novel The Ghost From The Grand Banks. Good job guys.

title: Excellent - and I've some suggestions for making it better!
comment: First of all - thank you! Lovely app. And a splendid undergraduate project. The detail is breath taking.  It would be even better, tho, if one could have information on the number of iterations being performed. A simple counter would be adequate.  Also, an optional grid for the (x,y) axes would be helpful.

title: Great but...
comment: I'd give it 5 stars if it had more color control, like xaos for desktops. Also the Julia sets dim when zooming.  But very good work...keep at it!

title: Colors
comment: I would like to see smoother color gradients.

title: Great app
comment: Crashes occasionally but otherwise excellent.

title: Great stuff!
comment: Add some coloring algorithms why don't ya? And props for releasing your code - anyone who really takes pride in their work should do so!

title: Interesting
comment: Color schemes are not very good.

title: Maximum zoom depth reached
comment: Wish it could zoom farther. Support arbitrary precision?

title: Best rendering time
comment: And also open source! Best among other fractals apps I tried.

title: Awesome, but...
comment: There is one thing I love to see in a Mandelbrot generator: the option for arbitrarily long numbers. Not even sure such libraries exist for Android, and as a rule they are much slower, but that moment where you hit the 32-bit "red shift" when poking around is always a bummer. With that (rarely implemented) proviso out of the way, this is a fast, friendly, elegant generator. Hope it did well for you on your project grade!

title: Needs a big droid
comment: adb pushed it onto my sons NABI. It's great there. Add conventional 1 finger zoom for 5 stars...

title: Great App
comment: It implements the Mandelbrot and Julia set with smooth rendering, full use of the touch screen, and well documented controls.

title: Great app
comment: I thought about doing something like this myself, but there's no need -- this app is so great for exploring Mandelbrot fractals!

title: Cool in HD
comment: On a full HD screen, with lots of detail, rendering can easily take a while - but the results are mesmerizing!

title: Excellent
comment: Excellet

title: nice app
comment: keep up the good work.

title: Does what it says on the tin
comment: An essential app for looking at Mandelbrot maps

title: just amazing
comment: very smooth, this has to be the best Mandelbrot app i have seen in a while.

title: Very fast fractal generator for Android
comment: This is just amazing. I've got a powerful desktop PC but this renders fractals on my Galaxy Tab 10.1 at lightning speed.

title: Perfect
comment: Beautiful application

title: Beautiful
comment: This is a great app! It renders very quickly and the results looks gorgeous. I really like the Julia set functionality too.

title: Ugly
comment: Poor choice of colours

title: Good
comment: Is %2 really optimal? Try (&1) in case as ARM divide takes dozens of cycles.

title: Excellent
comment: Quick and easy fun.

title: Awesome
comment: Awesome app, works really well. No problems on my xperia arc.

title: Interesting little app
comment: I'd never seen this Julia-Mandlebrot relationship before. Easy to use and clear help text re-enforcing what I'd discovered by clicking stiff. Maybe disable render time by default?

title: Very responsive.
comment: Quite fun to play with especially being able to see the Julia set change depending on the position of the Mandlebrot selected. Very quick and responsive on the Samsung Galaxy Ace though as expected the deeper you go the longer it took to render. Though this would be improved on a tablet or a higher range phone I'm sure. Still the wait was never really more than a minute even when very deep. I see myself wasting too much time on this.

title: Very cool!
comment: A lot more responsive than I would have expected. Rendering never took more than a fraction over a second at the default detail level. Good idea having the two-pass rendering when zooming.  The only pain was (maybe a platform problem rather than your programming?) that when placing the pin-point by long touching the screen it is sometimes a little over sensitive to movement. I.e. if my finger moves ever-so-slightly it will scroll rather than placing the pin-point.  Overall though, excellent! I now have a sweet new Julia set wallpaper for my phone :)

title: Excellent!
comment: Clear, usable, fast. Great app!

title: Awesome fractal app!
comment: Love it
Super fast!

title: Great way to view fractals
comment: Quick even on my HTC Hero, this lets you view not one, not five, but TWO badass fractals on screen at once!

title: The only real time Mandelbrot app
comment: There are other Mandelbrot apps, but no other lets you see the relation between Mandelbrot and Julia in real time. Awesome!

title: Amazing
comment: So much interactivity for such a complex problem. Good job!
